de.purpose: Zur Dokumentation des Ergebnisses - einschlieÃlich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenhÃ¤ngen.
de.use:
Zur Dokumentation des Ergebnisses - einschlieÃlich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenhÃ¤ngen. Dies geschieht in der Regel in einem Labor, kann aber auch in anderen Bereichen, wie z.B. am Point of Care, durchgefÃ¼hrt werden. 

Dieser Archetyp soll das Ergebnis einer erforderlichen Einzeluntersuchung abdecken, bei der die Probe(n) Ã¼ber ein Einzelverfahren gesammelt werden, und kann mehrere Ergebnisse zu Analyten oder andere Komponenten enthalten. Beispiele hierfÃ¼r kÃ¶nnte das âVollblutbildâ sein, das ein separates Analyseergebnis fÃ¼r die ZÃ¤hlung jedes Blutzelltyps liefert, oder âNierenbiopsie nicht neoplastischâ, das Ergebnisse aus der Mikroskopie, Immunhistochemie und Elektronenmikroskopie liefern wÃ¼rde.

Dieser Archetyp wurde als Framework konzipiert, das in der Regel um CLUSTER-Archetypen erweitert wird, um eine angemessene Aufzeichnung spezifischer Labor-Testergebnismuster zu ermÃ¶glichen. EinschlieÃlich aber nicht beschrÃ¤nkt auf: Tests fÃ¼r Biochemie, HÃ¤matologie, Immunologie und Blutspendendienste etc. sowie spezifische Muster fÃ¼r die besonderen Anforderungen an Mikrobiologie und anatomische Pathologie. Wenn die in Auftrag gegebenen Tests oder Untersuchungen nicht gewÃ¶hnlich in einer benannten Gruppe oder einem benannten Panel zusammengehÃ¶ren, wird jedes Testergebnis in der Regel durch separate Instanzen dieses Archetyps dargestellt. Es gibt jedoch erhebliche Unterschiede in der tatsÃ¤chlichen Berichts-/Messaging-Praxis, und dieser Archetyp/diese verwandten Archetypen sind so konzipiert, dass sie mit diesen Abweichungen umgehen kÃ¶nnen. 

Dieser Archetyp unterstÃ¼tzt mehrere AnsÃ¤tze zur Erfassung von Proben und spiegelt die aktuelle, sehr unterschiedliche Praxis wieder. Ein Laborergebnis hat einen hohen Grad an Ãbereinstimmung mit einer HL7 FHIR Diagnoseberichtsquelle. 

Es wird erwartet, dass ein oder mehrere Exemplare dieses Archetyps oder dieser Archetypfamilie an einen anfragenden Arzt innerhalb eines Labordokuments zurÃ¼ckgeschickt werden, das COMPOSITION.report_result Archetyp, oder Ã¤hnliche und andere relevante ENTRY Archetypen.

Die Erfassung von StÃ¶rfaktoren kann inkonsistent sein, weil es oft vom Quelllabor und von den klinischen Informationen, die angefordert worden, abhÃ¤ngt. Im State-Abschnitt des Archetyps gibt es ein einfaches Datenelement "Confounding factors", das optional ist und als eine MÃ¶glichkeit wiederholt werden kann, eine Vielzahl von einfachen Faktoren zu erfassen, die explizit gemacht werden mÃ¼ssen, da sie die Interpretation der Ergebnisse beeinflussen kÃ¶nnen. Wenn die StÃ¶rfaktoren komplexer sind, kann es sinnvoll sein, einen lokalen/gemeinsamen CLUSTER-Archetyp zu erstellen, der im SLOT "Confounding factors details" ergÃ¤nzt werden kann. 
Hinweis 1: Bekannte oder erforderliche Voraussetzungen, wie z.B. "Fasten" oder "Tag 1 des Menstruationszyklus", sollten im Datenelement "Probenbedingungen" im Archetyp CLUSTER.Probe, verschachtelt innerhalb des OBSERVATION Archetypes, angegeben werden.
Hinweis 2: Bekannte Probleme bei der Probenentnahme oder Behandlung, wie z.B. "Probe hÃ¤molysiert" oder "verlÃ¤ngerter Gebrauch von Tourniquet", sollten unter "ProbenqualitÃ¤t" im Archetyp CLUSTER.Probe, verschachtelt innerhalb des OBSERVATION Archetypes, angegeben werden.

Werden vom Labor "Reflextests" durchgefÃ¼hrt, kÃ¶nnen diese gemÃ¤Ã den US/FHIR-Richtlinien (siehe https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreportguide.html) oder anderen lokalen Richtlinien durchgefÃ¼hrt werden. Zum Beispiel eine der folgenden Punkte.... 
1. Protokollierung der Reflextestergebnisse zusÃ¤tzliche "Testergebnisse" innerhalb derselben "openEHR-EHROBSERVATION.Laborergebnis". 
2. Protokollierung der Reflextestergebnisse zusÃ¤tzliche "Testergebnisse" innerhalb derselben "openEHR-EHROBSERVATION.Laborergebnis", verweisen Sie aber Ã¼ber "Testerforderungsdetails" auf den ursprÃ¼nglichen Labortestantrag. 
3. Protokollierung der Reflextestergebnisse zusÃ¤tzliche "Testergebnisse" innerhalb derselben "openEHR-EHROBSERVATION.Laborergebnis" festhalten, aber Ã¼ber "Testerforderungsdetails" auf einen neuen Labortestantrag sowie den ursprÃ¼nglichen Labortestantrag verweisen.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Dokumentation eines Autopsieberichts oder eines forensischen Berichts verwenden. Einzelne Proben, die bei einer Autopsie oder einem forensischen Bericht entnommen werden, kÃ¶nnen jedoch mit diesem Archetyp dargestellt werden. FÃ¼r diese sind zusÃ¤tzliche spezialisierte Archetypen erforderlich, um die Daten zu dokumentieren.

Dieser Archetyp eignet sich zur Darstellung allgemeiner Labortestergebnisse, jedoch nicht fÃ¼r vollstÃ¤ndige synoptische Berichte. FÃ¼r diese sind zusÃ¤tzliche spezialisierte Archetypen erforderlich, um die Daten zu dokumentieren.

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieundersÃ¸kelse utfÃ¸rt pÃ¥ prÃ¸vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet.
nb.use:
Brukes for Ã¥ registrere resultat, funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieundersÃ¸kelse utfÃ¸rt pÃ¥ prÃ¸vemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet. Dette utfÃ¸res typisk i et laboratorium, men kan ogsÃ¥ gjÃ¸res i andre miljÃ¸er, som for eksempel ved pasientnÃ¦r analysering.

Denne arketypen er ment Ã¥ dekke resultatet av Ã©n rekvirert undersÃ¸kelse der prÃ¸vene er tatt i Ã©n prosedyre, og som kan ha flere analyseresultater eller andre komponenter. Eksempler pÃ¥ dette kan vÃ¦re "Differensialtelling av leukocytter", som gir et separat resultat for antallet av hver type hvite blodceller, eller "Nyrebiopsi ikke-neoplastisk", som gir resultater fra mikroskopi, immunohistokjemi og elektronmikroskopi.

Denne arketypen er laget for Ã¥ vÃ¦re et rammeverk som vanligvis vil utvides med CLUSTER-arketyper for Ã¥ fÃ¥ en hensiktsmessig registrering og rapportering av spesifikke mÃ¸nstre for laboratorieresultater. Dette kan omfatte analyser og undersÃ¸kelser innen kjemi (medisinsk biokjemi, hematologi, immunologi og transfusjonsmedisin, med mer), samt spesifikke mÃ¸nstre for de unike behovene innenfor mikrobiologi og patologi. Hvis de rekvirerte analysene eller undersÃ¸kelsene ikke tilhÃ¸rer en navngitt gruppe, vil hvert resultat normalt representeres ved en separat instans av denne arketypen. Imidlertid er det stor variasjon pÃ¥ hvordan svarrapportering/meldingsformidling skjer, og denne arketypen er designet for Ã¥ ivareta disse variasjonene.

Denne arketypen stÃ¸tter flere tilnÃ¦rminger til Ã¥ registrere informasjon om prÃ¸vematerialet, noe som reflekterer de store variasjonene innenfor dagens praksis. Laboratoriesvar-arketypen har hÃ¸y grad av samsvar med HL7 FHIR-ressursen "Diagnostic Report".

Det forventes at en eller flere instanser av denne arketypen, eller arketypefamilen vil bli sendt tilbake til rekvirenten i en laboratoriesvarrapport, for eksempel i arketypen COMPOSITION.report_result eller tilsvarende, og sammen med relevante ENTRY-arketyper.

Registrering av konfunderende faktorer gjÃ¸res i praksis ikke pÃ¥ en konsistent mÃ¥te, og avhenger av avsenderlaboratoriet og av den kliniske informasjonen som ble sendt med fra rekvirenten. I "State"-delen av arketypen er det et valgfritt og repeterbart element for "Konfunderende faktorer" som kan brukes til Ã¥ registrere enkle faktorer, som fordi de kan pÃ¥virke tolkningen av resultatet mÃ¥ registreres eksplisitt. Dersom de konfunderende faktorene er mer komplekse kan det vÃ¦re hensiktsmessig Ã¥ lage en CLUSTER-arketype som kan brukes i SLOTet "Strukturerte konfunderende faktorer".
NB 1: Kjente eller nÃ¸dvendige forutsetninger, som for eksempel "fastende" eller "dag 1 av menstruasjonssyklusen" bÃ¸r registreres i elementet "PrÃ¸vetakingsforhold" i arketypen CLUSTER.specimen, og nÃ¸stes inn i denne OBSERVATION-arketypen.
NB 2: Kjente problemer med prÃ¸vetaking eller prÃ¸vehÃ¥ndtering, som for eksempel "hemolyse" eller "forlenget stase" bÃ¸r registreres i elementet "PrÃ¸vekvalitet" i arketypen CLUSTER.specimen, og nÃ¸stes inn i denne OBSERVATION-arketypen.

Der laboratoriet endrer analyser eller legger til analyser som oppfÃ¸lging, kan disse hÃ¥ndteres etter veilledning fra HL7 FHIR (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html), eller etter lokale prosedyrer. For eksempel en av fÃ¸lgende:
1. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene innenfor samme instans av denne arketypen.
2. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene i en ny instans av denne arketypen, men referer til den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen ved hjelp av "Rekvisisjonsdetaljer".
3. Registrer de endrede analysene/tilleggsanalysene i en ny instans av denne arketypen, men referer til en ny rekvisisjon i tillegg til den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen, ved hjelp av "Rekvisisjonsdetaljer".
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes for Ã¥ lagre en sammenstilling etter obduksjon eller rettsmedisinsk undersÃ¸kelse, selv om prÃ¸ver av noen prÃ¸vematerialer som blir tatt i en obduksjon kan bli representert i denne arketypen. For Ã¥ lage selve obduksjons- eller den rettsmedisinske rapporten mÃ¥ man bruke spesialiserte arketyper.

Denne arketypen er passende for Ã¥ representere generelle laboratoriesvar, men er ikke ment Ã¥ dekke komplette sammendragsrapporter ("synoptic reports") innenfor patologi. For disse trengs det i tillegg spesialiserte arketyper.

en.purpose: To record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.
en.use:
Use to record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual. This is typically done in a laboratory, but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care.

This archetype is intended to cover the result of a single ordered investigation where the specimen(s) are collected as a single procedure, and may include multiple analyte results or other components. Examples of this could include 'Full blood count', which would yield a separate analyte result for the count of each type of blood cell, or 'kidney biopsy non-neoplastic', which would yield findings from microscopy, immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.

This archetype has been designed to be a framework that will usually be extended with CLUSTER archetypes to enable appropriate recording of specific laboratory test result patterns. This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

This archetype supports multiple approaches to recording of specimen, reflecting current practice which varies enormously. A Laboratory test result has a high degree of alignment to an HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report resource.

It is anticipated that one or more instances of this archetype, or archetype family, will be sent back to a requesting clinician within a laboratory report document comprising COMPOSITION.report_result archetype, or similar, and other relevant ENTRY archetypes.

The recording of confounding factors may be inconsistent, often depending on the analysing laboratory and on clinical information sent by the requester. In the State section of the archetype there is a simple 'Confounding factors' data element that is optional and can be repeated as one way to record a variety of simple factors that need to be made explicit as they may influence interpretation of the results. If the confounding factors are more complex, it may be appropriate to create a local/shared CLUSTER archetype that can be nested in the 'Confounding factors details' SLOT. 
Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record an Autopsy or a Forensic report, although tests on some specimens that are taken in such situations may be represented using this archetype. For these, additional or specialised archetypes will be required to represent the data.

This archetype is suitable for representation of general laboratory test results, but not intended to cover full synoptic reports. For these, additional specialising archetypes are required to represent the data.

it.purpose: Registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo.
keywords: lab, patologia, biochimica, ematologia, microbiologia, immunologia, laboratorio, anatomia, chimica, clinica, immunopatologia, citologia, istopatologia, test, biopsia, campione, medicina legale, genetica, medicina di laboratorio, risultati, analisi
it.use:
Utilizzato per registrare il risultato, compresi i riscontri e l'interpretazione del laboratorio, di un'indagine effettuata su campioni raccolti su un individuo o relativi a quell'individuo. Questo Ã¨ tipicamente fatto in un laboratorio, ma puÃ² essere fatto in altri ambienti, come ad esempio al punto di cura.

Questo archetipo Ã¨ inteso per coprire il risultato di una singola indagine ordinata in cui il campione o i campioni sono raccolti come un'unica procedura, e puÃ² includere risultati di analiti multipli o altri componenti. Esempi di ciÃ² potrebbero includere l' "emocromo completo", che darebbe un risultato dell'analisi separato per il conteggio di ciascun tipo di cellula del sangue, o la "biopsia renale non neoplastica", che darebbe risultati da microscopia, immunoistochimica e microscopia elettronica.

Questo archetipo Ã¨ stato progettato per essere un quadro di riferimento che di solito viene esteso con archetipi CLUSTER per consentire la registrazione appropriata di specifici modelli di risultati di test di laboratorio. Questo include, ma non si limita ai test per la biochimica, l'ematologia, l'immunologia e i servizi trasfusionali, ecc. e pattern specifici per i requisiti specializzati per microbiologia e anatomia patologica. Se i test o le indagini ordinati non appartengono comunemente a un gruppo o a un panel, ogni risultato di test verrebbe normalmente rappresentato utilizzando istanze separate di questo archetipo. Vi Ã¨, tuttavia, una notevole variazione nella pratica effettiva di refertazione/comunicazione e questo archetipo e gli archetipi correlati sono progettati per gestire tale variazione.

Questo archetipo supporta approcci multipli alla registrazione dei campioni, riflettendo la pratica corrente che varia enormemente. Il risultato di un test di laboratorio ha un alto grado di allineamento con la risorsa HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report.

Si prevede che una o piÃ¹ istanze di questo archetipo, o famiglia di archetipi, saranno inviate ad un clinico richiedente all'interno di un documento di rapporto di laboratorio che comprende l'archetipo COMPOSITION.report_result, o simile, e altri archetipi ENTRY rilevanti.

La registrazione dei fattori di confusione puÃ² essere incoerente, spesso a seconda del laboratorio di analisi e delle informazioni cliniche inviate dal richiedente. Nella sezione Stato dell'archetipo c'Ã¨ un semplice elemento ("fattori di confondimento"), che Ã¨ facoltativo e puÃ² essere ripetuto come un modo per registrare una varietÃ  di semplici fattori che devono essere resi espliciti in quanto possono influenzare l'interpretazione dei risultati. Se i fattori confondenti sono piÃ¹ complessi, puÃ² essere opportuno creare un archetipo CLUSTER locale o condiviso, che puÃ² essere annidato nello SLOT "Dettagli dei fattori confondenti".
Nota 1: Le precondizioni conosciute o richieste, come il 'digiuno' o il 'Giorno 1 del ciclo mestruale', devono essere riportate nell'elemento di dati 'Condizioni di campionamento' dell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OSSERVAZIONE.
Nota 2: I problemi noti relativi alla raccolta o al trattamento dei campioni, come "emolisi del campione" o "uso prolungato del laccio emostatico", devono essere riportati in "QualitÃ  del campione" nell'archetipo CLUSTER.specimen, annidato all'interno di questo archetipo OBSERVATION.

Se i "reflex test" vengono eseguiti dal laboratorio, questi possono essere gestiti secondo le linee guida US/FHIR (vedi https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) o altre politiche locali. Ad esempio, uno dei seguenti ...
1. Registrare i risultati addizionali dei reflex test come 'Risultati dei test' all'interno dello stesso 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'.
2. 2. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla richiesta originale del test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
3. 3. Registrare i risultati del reflex test come 'Risultati del test' all'interno di un nuovo 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result', ma fare riferimento alla nuova richiesta di test di laboratorio insieme alla richiesta originale di test di laboratorio tramite 'Dettagli della richiesta di test'.
it.misuse:
Da non utilizzare per registrare un'autopsia o un rapporto forense, anche se i test su alcuni campioni prelevati in tali situazioni possono essere rappresentati utilizzando questo archetipo. Per questi, saranno necessari archetipi aggiuntivi o specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

Questo archetipo Ã¨ adatto per la rappresentazione dei risultati generali dei test di laboratorio, ma non Ã¨ destinato a coprire i rapporti sinottici completi. Per questi, sono necessari ulteriori archetipi specializzati per rappresentare i dati.

nl.purpose: Voor het vastleggen van de uitslag, inclusief bevindingen en de interpretatie van het laboratorium, van een onderzoek uitgevoerd op een specimen van een individu of gerelateerd aan een individu.
nl.use:
*Use to record the result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual. This is typically done in a laboratory, but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care.

This archetype is intended to cover the result of a single ordered investigation where the specimen(s) are collected as a single procedure, and may include multiple analyte results or other components. Examples of this could include 'Full blood count', which would yield a separate analyte result for the count of each type of blood cell, or 'kidney biopsy non-neoplastic', which would yield findings from microscopy, immunohistochemistry and electron microscopy.

This archetype has been designed to be a framework that will usually be extended with CLUSTER archetypes to enable appropriate recording of specific laboratory test result patterns. This includes, but is not limited to, tests for biochemistry, haematology, immunology and transfusion services etc and specific patterns for the unique requirements for microbiology and anatomical pathology. If the ordered tests or investigations do not commonly belong together in a named group or panel, each test result would normally be represented using separate instances of this archetype. There is, however, considerable variation in actual reporting/messaging practice and this archetype/related archetypes are designed to handle such variation.

This archetype supports multiple approaches to recording of specimen, reflecting current practice which varies enormously. A Laboratory test result has a high degree of alignment to an HL7 FHIR Diagnostic Report resource.

It is anticipated that one or more instances of this archetype, or archetype family, will be sent back to a requesting clinician within a laboratory report document comprising COMPOSITION.report_result archetype, or similar, and other relevant ENTRY archetypes.

The recording of confounding factors may be inconsistent, often depending on the analysing laboratory and on clinical information sent by the requester. In the State section of the archetype there is a simple 'Confounding factors' data element that is optional and can be repeated as one way to record a variety of simple factors that need to be made explicit as they may influence interpretation of the results. If the confounding factors are more complex, it may be appropriate to create a local/shared CLUSTER archetype that can be nested in the 'Confounding factors details' SLOT. 
Note 1: Known or required pre-conditions, such as 'fasting' or 'Day 1 of menstrual cycle', should be reported in the 'Sampling conditions' data element in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.
Note 2: Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'sample haemolysed' or 'prolonged use of tourniquet' should be reported within 'Specimen quality' in the CLUSTER.specimen archetype, nested within this OBSERVATION archetype.

Where 'reflex tests' are performed by the laboratory, these may be handled as per US/FHIR guidance (see https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2015may/uslabreport-guide.html) or other local policy. For example, one of the following ...
1. Record the reflex test results additional 'Test findings' within the same 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result'
2. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but refer to the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.
3. Record the reflex test results as 'Test findings' within a new 'openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result' but reference a new lab test request as well as the original lab test request via 'Test request details'.(en)
nl.misuse:
*Not to be used to record an Autopsy or a Forensic report, although tests on some specimens that are taken in such situations may be represented using this archetype. For these, additional or specialised archetypes will be required to represent the data.

This archetype is suitable for representation of general laboratory test results, but not intended to cover full synoptic reports. For these, additional specialising archetypes are required to represent the data.(en)

at0000.description: *The result, including findings and interpretation, of a laboratory investigation performed on specimens from individuals or related materials(en)

at0002.description: Ø¥Ø­Ø¯Ù Ø§ÙÙÙØ§Ø¦Ø¹

at0005.description: *Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s). (en)
at0005.comment: *A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'. (en)

at0017.description: *Details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.(en)
at0017.comment:
*This slot is intended to carry details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.

The receiving laboratory may either perform the test or refer it to another laboratory. Where a different laboratory is responsible for performing the testing on specific analytes, it would be expected that these details would be carried in the 'Analyte result detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte archetype.

 (en)

at0035.description: *Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the test result.(en)
at0035.comment: *The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.(en)

at0037.description: *This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.(en)

at0038.description: *The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.(en)

at0040.description: *The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.(en)

at0057.comment: *For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'. (en)

at0062.description: *The local ID assigned to the test order by the order requester.(en)
at0062.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.(en)

at0063.description: *The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).(en)
at0063.comment: *Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.(en)

at0065.description: *Details about the physical substance that has been analysed, in the situation where all results in this test are derived from the same specimen.(en)
at0065.comment: *If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test name, then this additional data is not required. If there are multiple specimens, these may be represented per 'Result group'.(en)

at0068.description: *A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process. (en)
at0068.comment: *This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test. (en)

at0073.description: *The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.(en)
at0073.comment:
*The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements. (en)

at0074.description: *The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').(en)

at0075.description: *The date and/or time that âOverall test statusâ was issued.(en)

at0077.description: *The diagnostic service or discipline that is responsible for the laboratory test result. (en)
at0077.comment: *This is intended to be a general categorisation and not to capture the organisational name of the laboratory. For example: anatomical pathology, immunology and transfusion medicine, medical microbiology, clinical pharmacology, medical genetics, medical biochemistry. Alternatively more granular sub categories or sub disciplines, such as endocrinology, haematology, and allergology services, may be used. This may assist clinicians in filtering between categories of results. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0090.description: *Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test result.(en)

at0094.comment: *In most situations there is one test request and a single corresponding test result, however this repeating cluster allows for the situation where there may be multiple test requests reported using a single test result. As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.(en)

at0097.description: *Results of the test performed on the specimen(s). (en)
at0097.comment: *This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure. (en)

at0098.description: *Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the laboratory test result. (en)
at0098.comment: *For example: 'Severe hepatic impairment', 'Salmonella contamination'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is strongly recommended, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'. (en)

at0100.description: *Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.(en)
at0100.comment: *This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.(en)

at0101.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0106.description: *Name of the original laboratory test requested. (en)
at0106.comment: *This data element is to be used when the test requested differs from the test actually performed by the laboratory. (en)

at0107.description: *The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.(en)

at0110.description: *Structured details about the method of analysis, device or interpretation used.(en)

at0111.description: *This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.(en)
at0111.comment: *True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).(en)

at0113.description: *Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.(en)
at0113.comment:
*'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0114.description: *Details of patient state that may alter interpretation of the laboratory test.(en)

at0115.description: *The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.(en)

at0116.description: *The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.(en)

at0117.description: *Slot to allow extension to support localisation or alignment with other standards/ reference models.(en)

at0118.description: *Digital image, video or diagram representing the test result.(en)
at0118.comment: *Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content.(en)

at0119.description: *Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.(en)

at0120.description: *Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.(en)

at0121.comment: *Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0122.description: *A structured or complex diagnosis for the laboratory test. (en)
at0122.comment: *For example: Anatomical pathology diagnoses consisting of several different axes such as morphology, etiology and function. (en)

at0005.description: Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s).
at0005.comment: A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

at0017.description: Details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.
at0017.comment:
This slot is intended to carry details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.

The receiving laboratory may either perform the test or refer it to another laboratory. Where a different laboratory is responsible for performing the testing on specific analytes, it would be expected that these details would be carried in the 'Analyte result detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte archetype.

at0035.description: Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the test result.
at0035.comment: The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.

at0037.description: This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.

at0038.description: The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.

at0040.description: The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.

at0057.description: Narrative description of the key findings.
at0057.comment: For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'.

at0062.description: The local identifier assigned by the requesting clinical system.
at0062.comment: Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.

at0063.description: The local identifier assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).
at0063.comment: Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.

at0065.description: Details about the physical substance that has been analysed.
at0065.comment: If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test name, then this additional data is not required. Linking results to specific specimens may be recorded using 'Specimen identifier' elements in both the CLUSTER.specimen and the various results CLUSTER archetypes.

at0068.description: A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process.
at0068.comment: This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test.

at0073.description: The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.
at0073.comment:
The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements.

at0074.description: The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').

at0075.description: The date and/or time that âOverall test statusâ was issued.

at0077.description: The diagnostic service or discipline that is responsible for the laboratory test result.
at0077.comment: This is intended to be a general categorisation and not to capture the organisational name of the laboratory. For example: anatomical pathology, immunology and transfusion medicine, medical microbiology, clinical pharmacology, medical genetics, medical biochemistry. Alternatively more granular sub categories or sub disciplines, such as endocrinology, haematology, and allergology services, may be used. This may assist clinicians in filtering between categories of results. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0090.description: Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test result.

at0094.comment:
In most situations there is one test request and a single corresponding test result, however this repeating cluster allows for the situation where there may be multiple test requests reported using a single test result.

As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.

at0097.description: Results of the test performed on the specimen(s).
at0097.comment: This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure.

at0098.description: Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the laboratory test result.
at0098.comment: For example: 'Severe hepatic impairment', 'Salmonella contamination'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is strongly recommended, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'.

at0100.description: Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.
at0100.comment: This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.

at0101.description: Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.

at0106.description: Name of the original laboratory test requested.
at0106.comment: This data element is to be used when the test requested differs from the test actually performed by the laboratory.

at0107.description: The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.

at0110.description: Structured details about the method of analysis, device or interpretation used.

at0111.description: This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.
at0111.comment: True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).

at0113.description: Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.
at0113.comment:
'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0114.description: Details of issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.
at0114.comment: For example: Last Normal Menstrual Period (LNMP).

at0115.description: The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.

at0116.description: The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.

at0117.description: Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
at0117.comment: For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

at0118.description: Digital image, video or diagram representing the test result.
at0118.comment: Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content.

at0119.description: Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.

at0120.description: Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.

at0121.description: Description about the method used to perform the test.
at0121.comment: Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0122.description: A structured or complex diagnosis for the laboratory test.
at0122.comment: For example: Anatomical pathology diagnoses consisting of several different axes such as morphology, etiology and function.

at0100.1.description: Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.
at0100.1.comment: This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.

at0111.1.description: This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.
at0111.1.comment: True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).

at0121.1.description: Description about the method used to perform the test.
at0121.1.comment: Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0101.1.description: Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.

at0113.1.description: Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.
at0113.1.comment:
'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0002.1.description: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

at0005.1.description: Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s).
at0005.1.comment: A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

at0068.1.description: A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process.
at0068.1.comment: This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test.

at0097.1.comment: This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements.

As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.

at0098.1.comment: For eksempel "Betydelig nedsatt leverfunksjon" eller "Salmonella". Koding med en terminologi foretrekkes, der det er mulig. Diagnosen bÃ¸r vÃ¦re i overensstemmelse med teksten i "Konklusjon".

at0077.1.description: LaboratoriefagomrÃ¥det, -disiplinen eller subdisiplinen som er ansvarlig for resultatet.
at0077.1.comment: Dette er ikke ment for Ã¥ gjenspeile laboratoriets interne organisering, men for Ã¥ angi hvilken laboratoriedisiplin analysene tilhÃ¸rer. For eksempel patologi, immunologi og transfusjonsmedisin, medisinsk mikrobiologi, klinisk farmakologi, medisinsk genetikk og medisinsk biokjemi. Eventuelt enda mer findelte subkategorier eller subdisipliner som f.eks. hormoner/endokrinologi, hematologi, allergologi. Dette hjelper klinikere med Ã¥ filtrere mellom resultatkategorier i henhold til lokalt oppsett. Koding med en terminologi er Ã¸nskelig, der det er mulig.

at0094.1.comment:
I de fleste situasjoner finnes det Ã©n rekvisisjon og ett korresponderende svar, men under noen omstendigheter kan flere rekvisisjoner representeres ved hjelp av en enkelt laboratorieresultat-arketype.

For eksempel kan en kliniker bestille "glukose" i en rekvisisjon og "urea og elektrolytter" i en ytterligere rekvisisjon, mens laboratoriet utfÃ¸rer begge analysene og sender en samlet rapport.

at0005.description: *Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s). (en)
at0005.comment: *A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'. (en)

at0017.description: *Details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.(en)
at0017.comment:
*This slot is intended to carry details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.

The receiving laboratory may either perform the test or refer it to another laboratory. Where a different laboratory is responsible for performing the testing on specific analytes, it would be expected that these details would be carried in the 'Analyte result detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte archetype.

 (en)

at0035.description: *Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the test result.(en)
at0035.comment: *The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.(en)

at0040.description: *The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.(en)

at0057.comment: *For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'. (en)

at0065.description: *Details about the physical substance that has been analysed, in the situation where all results in this test are derived from the same specimen.(en)
at0065.comment: *If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test name, then this additional data is not required. If there are multiple specimens, these may be represented per 'Result group'.(en)

at0068.description: *A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process. (en)
at0068.comment: *This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test. (en)

at0073.description: *The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.(en)
at0073.comment:
*The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements. (en)

at0075.description: *The date and/or time that âOverall test statusâ was issued.(en)

at0077.description: *The diagnostic service or discipline that is responsible for the laboratory test result. (en)
at0077.comment: *This is intended to be a general categorisation and not to capture the organisational name of the laboratory. For example: anatomical pathology, immunology and transfusion medicine, medical microbiology, clinical pharmacology, medical genetics, medical biochemistry. Alternatively more granular sub categories or sub disciplines, such as endocrinology, haematology, and allergology services, may be used. This may assist clinicians in filtering between categories of results. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0094.comment: *In most situations there is one test request and a single corresponding test result, however this repeating cluster allows for the situation where there may be multiple test requests reported using a single test result. As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.(en)

at0097.description: *Results of the test performed on the specimen(s). (en)
at0097.comment: *This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure. (en)

at0098.description: *Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the laboratory test result. (en)
at0098.comment: *For example: 'Severe hepatic impairment', 'Salmonella contamination'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is strongly recommended, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'. (en)

at0100.description: *Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.(en)
at0100.comment: *This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.(en)

at0101.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0106.description: *Name of the original laboratory test requested. (en)
at0106.comment: *This data element is to be used when the test requested differs from the test actually performed by the laboratory. (en)

at0110.description: *Structured details about the method of analysis, device or interpretation used.(en)

at0111.description: *This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.(en)
at0111.comment: *True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).(en)

at0113.description: *Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.(en)
at0113.comment:
*'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0115.description: *The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.(en)

at0118.description: *Digital image, video or diagram representing the test result.(en)
at0118.comment: *Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content.(en)

at0119.description: *Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.(en)

at0120.description: *Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.(en)

at0121.comment: *Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0122.description: *A structured or complex diagnosis for the laboratory test. (en)
at0122.comment: *For example: Anatomical pathology diagnoses consisting of several different axes such as morphology, etiology and function. (en)

at0100.1.description: *Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.(en)
at0100.1.comment: *This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.(en)

at0111.1.description: *This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.(en)
at0111.1.comment: *True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).(en)

at0121.1.comment: *Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.  (en)

at0101.1.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0000.description: Das Ergebnis - einschlieÃlich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenhÃ¤ngen.

at0005.description: Name der Laboruntersuchung, die an der/den Probe(n) durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde.
at0005.comment:
Ein Laborergebnis kann sich auf ein einzelnes Analyt oder eine Analytgruppe beziehen. Dazu zÃ¤hlen auch komplette Panel an Parametern. 
Es wird dringend empfohlen, die "Labortest-Bezeichnung" anhand einer Terminologie zu kodiereren, wie zum Beispiel LOINC oder SNOMED CT. Beispiel: "Glukose", "Harnstoff", "Abstrich", "Cortisol", "Leberbiopsie". Der Name kann u.U. auch das Probenmaterial oder den Patientenstatus (z.B. "Blutzuckerspiegel nÃ¼chtern") oder andere Informationen beinhalten wie "Kalium (Blutgas)".

at0017.description: Angaben zu dem Labor, das die Anfrage erhalten hat und die Hauptverantwortung fÃ¼r die Verwaltung der Berichterstattung Ã¼ber den Test trÃ¤gt, auch wenn andere Labore bestimmte Aspekte ausfÃ¼hren.
at0017.comment:
Dieser Slot gibt die Details des Labors an, dass die Anforderung erhalten hat und die Gesamtverantwortung fÃ¼r die Berichterstellung des Tests trÃ¤gt, selbst wenn andere Labore bestimmte Aspekte ausfÃ¼hren.

Das Empfangslabor kann den Test entweder durchfÃ¼hren oder an ein anderes Labor verweisen. Wenn ein anderes Labor fÃ¼r die DurchfÃ¼hrung der Tests mit bestimmten Analyten zustÃ¤ndig ist, ist zu erwarten, dass diese Details im SLOT 'Analyte result detail' innerhalb des Archetyps CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte enthalten sind.

at0035.description: Details Ã¼ber weitere Kliniker oder Organisationen, die eine Kopie der Analyseergebnisse benÃ¶tigen.
at0035.comment: Die "Verteilerliste" dient nur zu Informationszwecken. Der HauptempfÃ¤nger des Berichts ist die Person, die dazu bestimmt ist, auf die Information zu reagieren.

at0037.description: Das Testergebnis ist als ein Teilergebnis (z.B. Initial, vorÃ¼bergehend oder vorlÃ¤ufig) bestÃ¤tigt: Daten im Testergebnis kÃ¶nnen unvollstÃ¤ndig oder nicht verifiziert sein.

at0038.description: Das Testergebnis ist vollstÃ¤ndig und durch eine autorisierte Person bestÃ¤tigt.

at0040.description: Das Ergebnis wurde nach der Finalisierung modifiziert und ist vollstÃ¤ndig von dem verantwortlichen Untersucher verifiziert. Die Ergebnisdaten wurden geÃ¤ndert.

at0057.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Das Muster lÃ¤sst auf eine erhebliche NierenfunktionsstÃ¶rung schlieÃen". Der Inhalt der Zusammenfassung unterscheidet sich je nach durchgefÃ¼hrter Untersuchung. Diese Zusammenfassung sollte mit der kodierten "Testdiagnose" Ã¼bereinstimmen.

at0062.description: Lokale Auftrags-ID des anfordernden/einsendenden Systems.

at0063.description: Lokale Auftrags-ID, die vom auftragsempfangendem System, gewÃ¶hnlich dem Laborinformationssystem (LIS) zugewiesen wird.
at0063.comment: Die Vergabe einer solchen ID ermÃ¶glicht das Nachverfolgen des Auftragsstatus und das Verlinken der Ergebnisse zum Auftrag. Es erlaubt auch das Verwalten von weiteren Erkundigungen und Nachfragen und ist Ã¤quivalent zum "HL7 Filler Order Identifier".

at0065.description: Angaben Ã¼ber die Beschaffenheit der analysierten Probe.
at0065.comment: Wenn der Probentyp mit einem Code in der Testbezeichnung ausreichend spezifiziert ist, sind diese zusÃ¤tzlichen Daten nicht erforderlich. Die VerknÃ¼pfung von Ergebnissen mit bestimmten Proben kann sowohl in einem CLUSTER.Probe als auch in den verschiedenen CLUSTER Archetypen mit Hilfe von Elementen mit der Bezeichnung "Probe" dokumentiert werden.

at0068.description: Eine lokale Kennung, die vom empfangenden Laborinformationssystem (LIS) vergeben wird, um den Testvorgang zu verfolgen.
at0068.comment: Diese Kennung ist eine vom LIS vergebene interne Trackingnummer und ist nicht als Bezeichnung fÃ¼r den Test gedacht.

at0073.comment:
Die Werte wurden so ausgewÃ¤hlt, dass sie mit denen im HL7 FHIR Diagnosebericht Ã¼bereinstimmen, der historisch aus der HL7v2Praxis stammt. Andere lokale Codes/Begriffe kÃ¶nnen Ã¼ber den Text "Auswahl" verwendet werden. 

Dieses Element kann mehrfach vorkommen, um FÃ¤lle abzudecken, bei denen der Status fÃ¼r verschiedene Aspekte des Ergebnisses in mehrere Elemente unterteilt wurde.

at0074.description: Das Ergebnis ist nicht verfÃ¼gbar, weil der Test nicht gestartet oder nicht abgeschlossen wurde (manchmal auch als "gescheitert" bezeichnet).

at0075.description: Zeitpunkt an dem das Ergebnis fÃ¼r den oben genannten "Gesamtteststatus" ausgegeben wurde.

at0077.description: Die diagnostische Organisationseinheit oder die Labordisziplin, die fÃ¼r das Laborergebnis verantwortlich ist.
at0077.comment: Dies soll eine allgemeine Kategorisierung sein und nicht den organisatorischen Namen des Labors erfassen. Zum Beispiel anatomische Pathologie, Immunologie und Transfusionsmedizin, medizinische Mikrobiologie, klinische Pharmakologie, medizinische Genetik, medizinische Biochemie. Alternativ noch granulÃ¤re Subkategorien, wie z.B. Hormone/Endokrinologie, HÃ¤matologie, AutoantikÃ¶rper, Allergologie. Diese Datenelemente helfen bei der Filterung nach breiten Kategorien von Ergebnissen gemÃ¤Ã den lokalen Gegebenheiten. Dieses Datenelement sollte, wenn mÃ¶glich, mit einer Terminologie kodiert werden.

at0090.description: Details Ã¼ber den Kliniker oder die Abteilung, die das Labortestergebnis angefordert hat.

at0094.comment:
In den meisten FÃ¤llen gibt es eine Testanfrage und ein einzelnes entsprechendes Testergebnis. Jedoch ermÃ¶glicht dieser wiederholte Cluster die Situation, dass mehrere Testanfragen mit einem einzigen Testergebnis gemeldet werden kÃ¶nnen.

Als Beispiel: "Ein Arzt fordert in einer Anfrage Blutzucker und in einer zweiten Anfrage Harnstoff/Elektrolyte an, aber das LaboranalysegerÃ¤t fÃ¼hrt beides durch und das Labor mÃ¶chte diese zusammen melden".

at0097.description: Ergebnisse der durchgefÃ¼hrten Untersuchungen an der/den Probe(n).
at0097.comment: Dieser SLOT kann einen einzelnen Analyt, eine Gruppe, ein Panel oder eine Reihe von mehreren Analyten oder eine komplexere und spezifischere Struktur tragen.

at0098.description: Kurze Beschreibung der klinischen Bedeutung und der Aussagekraft des Laborergebnisses.
at0098.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Schwere hepatische BeeintrÃ¤chtigung", "Salmonellenbefall". Die Kodierung der Diagnose mit einer Terminologie, wird nach MÃ¶glichkeit dringend empfohlen. Die Diagnose soll zu der Beschreibung im Datenelement "Zusammenfassung" passen.

at0100.description: Beschreibung der klinischen Informationen, die zum Zeitpunkt der Auswertung der Ergebnisse verfÃ¼gbar sind.
at0100.comment: Dieses Datenelement kann einen Link zu den ursprÃ¼nglichen klinischen Informationen enthalten, die in der Testanforderung angegeben sind.

at0101.description: Weitere Informationen Ã¼ber das Laborergebnis, welche bisher nicht in den anderen Feldern erfasst wurden.

at0106.comment: Dieses Datenelement ist zu verwenden, wenn die angeforderte Testung von der tatsÃ¤chlich vom Labor durchgefÃ¼hrten Testung abweicht.

at0107.description: Der Labortest wurde im Laborinformationssystem registriert, aber es ist derzeit noch nichts verfÃ¼gbar.

at0110.description: Strukturierte Details Ã¼ber die beim Labortest verwendete Methodik, das GerÃ¤t oder die Auswertung.

at0111.description: Dies gibt an, ob der Test direkt am Point-of-Care (POCT) durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde, im Gegensatz zu einem formalen Ergebnis eines Labors oder einer anderen Dienstleistungsorganisation.
at0111.comment: Wahr, wenn der Test direkt am Point-of-Care (POCT) durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde.

at0113.description: Probleme oder UmstÃ¤nde, die sich auf die genaue Interpretation der Messung oder des Testergebnisses auswirken.
at0113.comment:
"StÃ¶rfaktoren", die die Interpretation beeinflussen kÃ¶nnten wie z.B. "kÃ¼rzliches Training" oder "neuer Tabakkonsum" sollten fÃ¼r unkontrollierte/ungeplante Probleme des Patientenzustands/ der Physiologie vorgesehen werden.

Bekannte oder erforderliche Voraussetzungen, wie z.B. "Fasten", sollten im Element "Probenbedingungen" innerhalb des CLUSTER.Probe-Archetyps aufgefÃ¼hrt werden. In einigen FÃ¤llen werden Voraussetzungen als Teil des Testnamens erfasst, z.B. "NÃ¼chternblutzucker".

Bekannte Schwierigkeiten bei der Probenentnahme oder -behandlung, wie z.B. die "verlÃ¤ngerte Anwendung von Tourniquet" oder "hÃ¤molysierte Probe", sollten in den Elementen "ProbenqualitÃ¤t" innerhalb des CLUSTER.Probe-Archetyps aufgefÃ¼hrt werden.

at0114.description: Einzelheiten zu Problemen oder UmstÃ¤nden, die sich auf die genaue Interpretation der Messung oder des PrÃ¼fergebnisses auswirken.

at0115.description: Das Ergebnis wurde nach der Finalisierung modifiziert und ist vollstÃ¤ndig vom verantwortlichen Untersucher verifiziert. Dies ist eine Unterkategorie von "AbgeÃ¤ndert".

at0116.description: Das Testergebnis wurde nach der vorherigen Endfreigabe zurÃ¼ckgezogen.

at0117.comment: Zum Beispiel: Lokaler Informationsbedarf oder zusÃ¤tzliche Metadaten, um ein Mapping auf FHIR oder CIMI Modelle zu ermÃ¶glichen.

at0118.description: Bild, Video oder Diagramm zur Visualisierung des Testergebnisses.

at0119.description: Nach der endgÃ¼ltigen Fassung wurde der Bericht durch HinzufÃ¼gen neuer Inhalte aktualisiert. Der bestehende Inhalt bleibt unverÃ¤ndert. Dies ist eine Unterkategorie von "AbgeÃ¤ndert".

at0120.description: Es sind erste, bestÃ¤tigte Ergebnisse verfÃ¼gbar, aber nicht alle Ergebnisse sind final. Dies ist eine Unterkategorie von "Teilweise".

at0121.description: Die Beschreibung der Methode, mit dem der Test durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde.
at0121.comment: Wenn mÃ¶glich, ist eine Kodierung mit einer Terminologie wÃ¼nschenswert.

at0122.description: Eine strukturierte oder komplexe Diagnose fÃ¼r die Laboruntersuchung.
at0122.comment: Zum Beispiel: Anatomische Pathologiediagnosen, die aus mehreren verschiedenen Schwerpunkten wie Morphologie, Ãtiologie und Funktion zusammengesetzt sind.

at0113.1.description: Probleme oder UmstÃ¤nde, die sich auf die genaue Interpretation der Messung oder des Testergebnisses auswirken.
at0113.1.comment:
"StÃ¶rfaktoren", die die Interpretation beeinflussen kÃ¶nnten wie z.B. "kÃ¼rzliches Training" oder "neuer Tabakkonsum" sollten fÃ¼r unkontrollierte/ungeplante Probleme des Patientenzustands/ der Physiologie vorgesehen werden.

Bekannte oder erforderliche Voraussetzungen, wie z.B. "Fasten", sollten im Element "Probenbedingungen" innerhalb des CLUSTER.Probe-Archetyps aufgefÃ¼hrt werden. In einigen FÃ¤llen werden Voraussetzungen als Teil des Testnamens erfasst, z.B. "NÃ¼chternblutzucker".

Bekannte Schwierigkeiten bei der Probenentnahme oder -behandlung, wie z.B. die "verlÃ¤ngerte Anwendung von Tourniquet" oder "hÃ¤molysierte Probe", sollten in den Elementen "ProbenqualitÃ¤t" innerhalb des CLUSTER.Probe-Archetyps aufgefÃ¼hrt werden.

at0002.1.description: Jeder Zeitpunkt oder jedes Intervall, das in einem Template oder zur Laufzeit definiert werden kann.

at0057.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Das Muster lÃ¤sst auf eine erhebliche NierenfunktionsstÃ¶rung schlieÃen". Der Inhalt der Zusammenfassung unterscheidet sich je nach durchgefÃ¼hrter Untersuchung. Diese Zusammenfassung sollte mit der kodierten "Testdiagnose" Ã¼bereinstimmen.

at0005.1.description: Name der Laboruntersuchung, die an der/den Probe(n) durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde.
at0005.1.comment:
Ein Laborergebnis kann sich auf ein einzelnes Analyt oder eine Analytgruppe beziehen. Dazu zÃ¤hlen auch komplette Panel an Parametern. 
Es wird dringend empfohlen, die "Labortest-Bezeichnung" anhand einer Terminologie zu kodiereren, wie zum Beispiel LOINC oder SNOMED CT. Beispiel: "Glukose", "Harnstoff", "Abstrich", "Cortisol", "Leberbiopsie". Der Name kann u.U. auch das Probenmaterial oder den Patientenstatus (z.B. "Blutzuckerspiegel nÃ¼chtern") oder andere Informationen beinhalten wie "Kalium (Blutgas)".

at0068.1.description: Eine lokale Kennung, die vom empfangenden Laborinformationssystem (LIS) vergeben wird, um den Testvorgang zu verfolgen.
at0068.1.comment: Diese Kennung ist eine vom LIS vergebene interne Trackingnummer und ist nicht als Bezeichnung fÃ¼r den Test gedacht.

at0097.1.description: Ergebnisse der durchgefÃ¼hrten Untersuchungen an der/den Probe(n).
at0097.1.comment: Dieser SLOT kann einen einzelnen Analyt, eine Gruppe, ein Panel oder eine Reihe von mehreren Analyten oder eine komplexere und spezifischere Struktur tragen.

at0073.1.comment:
Die Werte wurden so ausgewÃ¤hlt, dass sie mit denen im HL7 FHIR Diagnosebericht Ã¼bereinstimmen, der historisch aus der HL7v2Praxis stammt. Andere lokale Codes/Begriffe kÃ¶nnen Ã¼ber den Text "Auswahl" verwendet werden. 

Dieses Element kann mehrfach vorkommen, um FÃ¤lle abzudecken, bei denen der Status fÃ¼r verschiedene Aspekte des Ergebnisses in mehrere Elemente unterteilt wurde.

at0098.1.description: Kurze Beschreibung der klinischen Bedeutung und der Aussagekraft des Laborergebnisses.
at0098.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Schwere hepatische BeeintrÃ¤chtigung", "Salmonellenbefall". Die Kodierung der Diagnose mit einer Terminologie, wird nach MÃ¶glichkeit dringend empfohlen. Die Diagnose soll zu der Beschreibung im Datenelement "Zusammenfassung" passen.

at0077.1.description: Die diagnostische Organisationseinheit oder die Labordisziplin, die fÃ¼r das Laborergebnis verantwortlich ist.
at0077.1.comment: Dies soll eine allgemeine Kategorisierung sein und nicht den organisatorischen Namen des Labors erfassen. Zum Beispiel anatomische Pathologie, Immunologie und Transfusionsmedizin, medizinische Mikrobiologie, klinische Pharmakologie, medizinische Genetik, medizinische Biochemie. Alternativ noch granulÃ¤re Subkategorien, wie z.B. Hormone/Endokrinologie, HÃ¤matologie, AutoantikÃ¶rper, Allergologie. Diese Datenelemente helfen bei der Filterung nach breiten Kategorien von Ergebnissen gemÃ¤Ã den lokalen Gegebenheiten. Dieses Datenelement sollte, wenn mÃ¶glich, mit einer Terminologie kodiert werden.

at0094.1.comment:
In den meisten FÃ¤llen gibt es eine Testanfrage und ein einzelnes entsprechendes Testergebnis. Jedoch ermÃ¶glicht dieser wiederholte Cluster die Situation, dass mehrere Testanfragen mit einem einzigen Testergebnis gemeldet werden kÃ¶nnen.

Als Beispiel: "Ein Arzt fordert in einer Anfrage Blutzucker und in einer zweiten Anfrage Harnstoff/Elektrolyte an, aber das LaboranalysegerÃ¤t fÃ¼hrt beides durch und das Labor mÃ¶chte diese zusammen melden".

at0000.1.description: Das Ergebnis - einschlieÃlich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenhÃ¤ngen.

at0065.1.description: Angaben Ã¼ber die Beschaffenheit der analysierten Probe.
at0065.1.comment: Wenn der Probentyp mit einem Code in der Testbezeichnung ausreichend spezifiziert ist, sind diese zusÃ¤tzlichen Daten nicht erforderlich. Die VerknÃ¼pfung von Ergebnissen mit bestimmten Proben kann sowohl in einem CLUSTER.Probe als auch in den verschiedenen CLUSTER Archetypen mit Hilfe von Elementen mit der Bezeichnung "Probe" dokumentiert werden.

at0000.description: L'esito, inclusi i risultati e l'interpretazione, di una indagine di laboratorio effettuata su campioni provenienti da individui o relativi materiali.

at0002.description: Predefinito, non specificato istante o intervallo di tempo, che puÃ² essere esplicitamente dettagliato in un template o in esecuzione (tempo reale)

at0005.description: Nome dell' indagine di laboratorio effettuata sul campione/i.
at0005.comment: Il risultato di un esame puÃ² essere relativo ad un singolo analita, oppure and un gruppo di elementi, inclusi i panel test. Si raccomanda vivamente di codificare il nome dell'esame tramite utilizzo di una terminologia, come ad esempio LOINC o SNOMED CT. Ad esempio: 'Glucosio', 'Urea ed elettroliti', 'Tampone', 'Cortisolo (am)', 'Potassio nella traspirazione' o 'Istopatologia del melanoma'. Il nome puÃ² talvolta includere il tipo di campione e lo stato del paziente, ad esempio 'Glucosio a digiuno' o includere altre informazioni, come 'Potassio (gas sanguigni PNA).

at0017.description: Dettagli riguardanti il laboratorio che ha ricevuto la richiesta ed ha la piena responsabilitÃ  di gestione del risultato dell'esame, anche nel caso in cui altri laboratori abbiano  eseguito specifiche parti.
at0017.comment: Questo campo viene utilizzato per indicare i dettagli riguardanti il laboratorio che ha ricevuto la richiesta ed ha la piena responsabilitÃ  di gestione del risultato dell'esame, anche nel caso  in cui altri laboratori ne abbiano eseguito delle specifiche parti. Il laboratorio ricevente potrebbe sia effettuare l'esame, oppure delegarlo verso un altro laboratorio. Quando un altro laboratorio Ã¨ responsabile dell'esecuzione del test su degli specifici analiti, ci si aspetta che  i relativi dettagli vengano riportati nello SLOT "Dettagli del risultato dell'analita", all'interno dell'archetipo CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte.

at0035.description: Dettagli su eventuale altro personale sanitario o organismi che hanno richiesto una copia del risultato dell'esame.
at0035.comment: La "Lista di distribuzione" ha soltanto scopo informativo, ed il destinatario principale della lista Ã¨ la persona ritenuta quella preposta ad agire sulle informazioni.

at0037.description: E' un risltato parziale(iniziale, provvisorio o preliminare) dell'esame: la data nel risultato dell'esame potrebbe essere incompleta, oppure non verificata.

at0038.description: Il risultato dell'esame Ã¨ completo ed Ã¨ stato verificato da una persona autorizzata.

at0040.description: Il risultato Ã¨ stato modificato dopo essere stato dichiarato come Definitivo, ed Ã¨ completo e verificato dal patologo responsabile e data dell'esito Ã¨ stata cambiata.

at0057.comment: Per esempio: "l'esito indica una significativa compromissione renale". Il contenuto delle conclusioni puÃ² variare, a seconda dell'indagine effettuata. Queste conclusioni dovrebbero essere allineate con quanto riportato nel campo "Diagnosi dell'esame".

at0062.description: ID locale assegnato all'ordine dell'esame dal sistema che lo ha richiesto
at0062.comment: E' equivalente al campo HL7 "Placer Order Identifier"

at0063.description: Identificativo locale assegnato all'ordine dell'esame dall'order filler, solitamente dal Sistema Informativo di Laboratorio (LIS).
at0063.comment: L'identificativo assegnato alla richiesta dal Sistema Informativo di Laboratorio (LIS) permette di tracciare lo stato di avanzamento della richiesta e di associare i risultati alle richieste. Fornisce anche un riferimento utile nelle indagini e di solito Ã¨ equivalente al campo HL7 "Filler Order Identifier".

at0065.description: Dettagli sulla sostanza fisica che Ã¨ stata analizzata.
at0065.comment: Se il tipo del campione Ã¨ specificato in maniera esaustiva all'interno del nome dell'esame, allora non Ã¨ richiesto alcun dettaglio. Nel caso di campioni multipli, questi possono essere rappresentati mediante "gruppo di risultati" ("Result group").

at0068.description: Identificativo locale assegnato dal Sistema Informativo di Laboratorio (LIS) ricevente, allo scopo di tracciare il processo dell'esame.
at0068.comment: Questo identivicativo Ã¨ un numero di tracciabilitÃ  interno assegnato dal LIS, e non il nome dell'esame.

at0073.description: Lo stato relativo all'esame di laboratorio nel suo complesso.
at0073.comment: I valori sono stati specificatamente scelti in moto tale da corrispondere a quelli del "FHIR Diagnostic Report" di HL7, a loro volta storicamente derivanti dal HL7 v2. Altre codifiche/terminologie locali possono essere utilizzare tramite la scelta "Text". Questo elemento ha occorrenze multiple al fine di soddisfare le esigenze di quegli use case in cui gli stati relativi a differenti aspetti del risultato sono stati divisi in piÃ¹ componenti.

at0074.description: Il risultato non Ã¨ disponibile perchÃ© il test non Ã¨ stato avviato o non Ã¨ stato completato (talvolta chiamato anche 'abortito').

at0075.text: Timestamp dello stato generale del test
at0075.description: La data e/o l'ora in cui Ã¨ stato rilasciato lo "Stato complessivo dell'esame".

at0077.description: Il servizio diagnostico o la disciplina che Ã¨ responsabile del risultato del test di laboratorio.
at0077.comment: Questa vuole essere una categorizzazione generale e non registrare il nome organizzativo del laboratorio. Per esempio: anatomia patologica, immunologia e medicina trasfusionale, microbiologia medica, farmacologia clinica, genetica medica, biochimica medica. In alternativa possono essere utilizzate sottocategorie o sottodiscipline piÃ¹ granulari, come endocrinologia, ematologia e servizi di allergologia. Questo puÃ² aiutare i medici a filtrare tra le categorie di risultati. La codifica con una terminologia Ã¨ auspicabile, ove possibile.

at0090.description: Dettagli del clinico o dell'organizzazione che richiede il risultato dell'esame di laboratorio.

at0094.comment:
Nella maggior parte delle situazioni c'Ã¨ una richiesta di test e un singolo risultato di test corrispondente, tuttavia questo cluster di ripetizione permette la situazione in cui ci possano essere richieste di test multipli segnalati utilizzando un singolo risultato di test.

Come esempio: "un clinico chiede il glucosio nel sangue in una richiesta e gli urei/elettroliti in una seconda richiesta, ma l'analizzatore di laboratorio fa entrambe le cose e il laboratorio desidera riportare queste richieste insieme".

at0097.description: Risultati del test eseguito sul campione o sui campioni.
at0097.comment: Questo SLOT puÃ² riportare un singolo analita, un gruppo, un pannello o una batteria di piÃ¹ analiti, o una struttura piÃ¹ complessa e specifica.

at0098.description: Singola parola, frase o breve descrizione che rappresenta il significato clinico e la significativitÃ  del risultato del test di laboratorio.
at0098.comment: Per esempio: 'Grave insufficienza epatica', 'Contaminazione da Salmonella'. Si raccomanda vivamente, ove possibile, di codificare la diagnosi con una terminologia. Questa diagnosi dovrebbe essere allineata con la narrazione nella 'Conclusione'.

at0100.description: Descrizione delle informazioni cliniche disponibili al momento dell'interpretazione dei risultati.
at0100.comment: Questo elemento di dati puÃ² includere un link alle informazioni cliniche originali fornite nella richiesta di test.

at0101.description: Narrativa aggiuntiva sul risultato del test non catturato in altri campi.

at0106.description: Nome del test di laboratorio originale richiesto.
at0106.comment: Questo elemento deve essere utilizzato quando il test richiesto differisce da quello effettivamente eseguito dal laboratorio.

at0107.description: L'esistenza del test Ã¨ registrata nel Sistema Informativo di Laboratorio, ma non c'Ã¨ ancora nulla di disponibile.
